div.p:
Your letter, dated 6 April, was yesterday placed before a meeting of the Trustees of the Royal Park, and I am directed to express the regretof our colleagues, that your remoteness from Melbourne continues to interfere with your attendance at our meetings, and that you thus have resolved to resign. Should this be your final decision, then the Trustees think your communication would need to be direct to the hon. the President of theBoard of Land and Works, by whom we all vere appointed.
Lyall's resignation was accepted31 May 1869and notified in Victoria government gazette, 4 June 1869, p. 625.He farmed at Koo-wee-rup, c. 80 km east of Melbourne.
Trusting that you still may be able to share actively in our labors I remain
